title: Change my mind
body:
You should never be permanently banned for flaming your teammates as long as you do not say anything Racist Homophobic or wishing death.

Change my mind

 Nobody is forcing OP to agree with the rules, they're more than welcome to find another game or company that's more compliant and meets their desires.

 The current rules boil down to nothing more than **"don't flame or do anything to intentionally ruin another player's experience."** The rules don't say "be a good person, go out of your way to become best friends with everyone!" 

You literally just have to _not_ flame or engage in arguments. I understand that it's easier said than done for some people (reminder, I was permanently banned on my first account, I'm definitely not a "goody two shoes" by any stretch of the imagination) but it's something everyone can realistically work towards and achieve.  

Going 0/25 Nunu mid while feeding is against the rules. Calling people on your team "fucking dumbasses" for failing a flash or dying in a trade is against the rules. AFKing is against the rules _(even though I would like the punishment for it to be more severe, but that's not really the point.)_ Everything is easy to understand and follow. If you feel the need to rag on teammates or enemies endlessly for small mistakes or over petty disagreements, that's cool.

_ League just ain't the game for it._ And that's just how it is.

How's about, rather than _we_ try to change _your_ mind, _you_ try to change _our_ minds?

Why do you think that flaming should be allowed? What benefits does it provide, and do those benefits outweigh the obvious negatives that come from flaming?

Frankly, "change my mind" style posts have no place on PB. As far as I'm concerned, they already present themselves as non-discussions as you're simply putting forward an idea that you don't actually want to change your stance on, and simply wish to watch people ineffectually raise counterpoints to it. It's disingenuous posting, it's not conducive to actual discussion, and it serves no purpose.

But hey, I'll bite.

Flaming should remain as a bannable offense because there's no legitimate benefit to allowing flaming, especially in comparison to the damage it does to team cohesion and group morale. You're playing a team game, and that means you're supposed to be _working with your teammates, **not** fighting them_, and that's all that flaming is. You're wasting your time fighting someone through text - so if it's flaming an enemy, it's utterly ineffectual and in breach of the rules of sportsmanship, and if you're flaming an ally, you're fighting your own teammates instead of working with them, so you're both breaking the rules of sportsmanship _and_ effectively trying to sabotage your team's chances of winning.

And to what benefit? A little bit of short-lived pleasure that you got the last word in against someone who you should be working with instead of harassing and fighting against? A little relief from venting out your frustrations on a teammate, when a dozen different and _more effective_ methods of venting exist? Flaming accomplishes _nothing_ that outweighs the fact that you are, effectively, low-key throwing the game.

And if that fact doesn't change your mind, then I pose the question: Did you even really come here to have your mind changed?

To be fair, getting the "little relief" from venting is pretty helpful to me. Sometimes I just need to get that stuff out. And yeah, it isn't always nice, and no, it may not be helpful to the team... BUT if I am flaming someone, the game is probably out of reach already; just being honest.

What are the more effective methods of venting you propose though? I am just wondering for future games of League

> BUT if I am flaming someone, the game is probably out of reach already; just being honest.

To be blunt while maintaining respect for your opinion; there is no condition or point in the game where flaming is allowed. Even in a monumentally clear, sweeping defeat, I believe that players should demonstrate their best behavior - or, failing that, at least play in close accordance to the rules.

> What are the more effective methods of venting you propose though? I am just wondering for future games of League

It will vary from person to person, but what I find most effective are forms of physical exertion (I typically slam my fists on my desk, though punching pillows/squeezing stress balls work just as well without risking damage to your table.), and yelling my frustrations at the screen over typing them out; it airs the frustration quicker and more efficiently and just kinda helps to breathe.

~~Hell, even Mythbusters has shown that shouting obscenities can help alleviate pain, so if it has that sort of sensory affect, surely to god it has merit to say it can help de-stress, too.~~

Other than that, there are decompression tools/toys that are purpose-built for de-stressing (fidget spinners, stress balls, butterfly trainers, etc.), and even practicing breathing exercises can help cool things down and allow you to refocus in stressful situations. Breathe for four seconds inwards, seven seconds outwards.

Bashing desk, will not do (because of reasons you mentioned)
Hitting pillows, unfortunately are not near
Yelling at the scream (if in comms, I will tell my teammates my thoughts, but I won't yell)
Honestly, I found that typing out all of my frustration does help A LOT. I just hit ESC once I type it, before hitting ENTER. Then I don't get into too much trouble with myself.

I have gotten better at muting negative people as well, so that is a good one.

Thanks for getting back to me

Your opinion of the rules is of zero relevance. When a cop stops you for going 40 in a 25 zone, you can claim "I think the limit should be 45 here" all you want. You're still getting a ticket. If a librarian asks you to keep your voice down while you use the facilities, shouting that libraries should be loud will simply get you escorted out. If you go to a friend's house who insists that you remove your shoes while you're in their home, "that's a stupid rule and I do what I want" will lose you a friend. If you are using someone else's services, facilities, equipment, etc., you abide by their rules or you deal with the consequences. If you think the rules should change, that is a completely different conversation (and I wouldn't give a plugged nickel for your chances at convincing Riot to change their rules to allow behavior like yours).

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024051193-Understanding-Different-Ban-Types-FAQs):

> We work with the overall community and within our own company guidelines to identify what disruptive behavior is and what the consequences for those behaviors should be. We understand that it can be difficult to know where the line is, which is why we provide chat logs and we have a few tiers in the ban process in order to allow for you to learn and grow.

I find that people that flame, get people to respond to them and cause flame wars where they don't focus on the game. Flamers aren't as bad for the quality of the game as for example feeders, but they certainly lower the bar.  Flaming often occurs in games of lower quality but flaming also lowers the quality of those games. For this exact reason I think flaming should be bannable.

Okay. You should never be banned for anything including homophobic/racist language. Think about it; everyone gets offended by things that are personal to them. Why is race or sexual orientation special? They can mute it just like flaming. Hell, flaming in general is annoying as shit. It doesnt really matter to me what they're saying, its more the audacity and arrogance to flame people over a video game, not a particular subject or opinion they have. Its like stfu either way. Maybe someone has a r%%%%%ed sibling, and thats what they take the most offense to. Why should saying r%%%%%ed not matter, but saying a made up word for a skin color does? I dont get that logic. Dont really care if I change your mind though. Its good that people have different opinions. I dont want a bunch of me's walkin around... that would be a disaster.

Also, wishing death? Why is that something bannable? What about wishing physical harm in general?
Okay, saying racist and homophobic things are as fine as saying curse words and you should never be banned for speech.
